page.title: 14A Visit to Alton
page.content: Here are some places you might go to on a visit to Alton: The Watercress Line, opened in 1977 and added to this year, now runs from Alton to Ropley and is operated by steam trains. St.Lawrence Church still bears the marks of a battle between Roundhead soldiers who made a surprise attack on the town, and Cavalier forces, during the Civil War. Market Square is the scene for Market Day, held on Tuesdays. The Curtis Museum has exhibits which record the history of Alton and its people from Roman times, its traditional crafts and brewing, and the area's wildlife. The Butts is a triangular piece of land at the south west entry to the town, an open space once used for archery practice, but now for fairs.
